Enum Class Difficulty

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Enum<Difficulty>
application.Difficulty
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<Difficulty>, Constable
public enum Difficulty extends Enum<Difficulty>
Represents the difficulty levels available in the game, each with predefined map layouts.

Each difficulty level provides a different map configuration that affects:

  • Resource distribution and density
  • Enemy placement and frequency
  • Map complexity and challenge level
  • Overall game progression pace

The enum also contains static methods that return pre-defined 2D array map layouts where each integer corresponds to a specific cell type.

  • Enum Constant Summary

    Enum Constants
    Enum Constant
    Description
    EASY
    Easy difficulty - simpler layout with abundant resources and fewer challenges.
    HARD
    Hard difficulty - complex layout with scarce resources and increased challenges.
    MEDIUM
    Medium difficulty - balanced layout with moderate resource distribution and challenges.

  • Enum Constant Details

    • EASY

      public static final Difficulty EASY
      Easy difficulty - simpler layout with abundant resources and fewer challenges. Suitable for beginners learning game mechanics.

    • MEDIUM

      public static final Difficulty MEDIUM
      Medium difficulty - balanced layout with moderate resource distribution and challenges. Provides a well-rounded gaming experience.

    • HARD

      public static final Difficulty HARD
      Hard difficulty - complex layout with scarce resources and increased challenges. Designed for experienced players seeking greater difficulty.
